str2: However, nevertheless, but, except that, yet. From pleion; moreover, i.e. Albeit, save that, rather, yet.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
